org.jcvi.jillion.trace.sff

Interface SffFlowgram

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Trace

    public interface SffFlowgram
extends Trace
    A Flowgram is a next-generation trace created using pyrosequencing.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    See Also:
    Pyrosequencing Wikipedia Article

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this SffFlowgram with the specified Object for equality.
      Range getAdapterClip()
      The adapter clip points that specify the subset of the basecalls that are not adapter sequence.
      float getCalledFlowValue(int index)
      Get the flow value for the given flow index.
      String getId()
      The name of this flowgram.
      int getNumberOfFlows()
      Get the number of flows that this flowgram has.
      Range getQualityClip()
      The quality clip points that specify the subset of the basecalls that are good quality.
      short[] getRawEncodedFlowValues()
      Get the raw flowgram values which contains the homopolymer stretch estimates for each flow of the read.

      Get the raw flow indexes in the array returned by getRawEncodedFlowValues()
      int hashCode()

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jcvi.jillion.trace.Trace

        getLength, getNucleotideSequence, getQualitySequence

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        The name of this flowgram.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Trace
        Returns:
        the id as a String; will never be null.

      • getQualityClip

        Range getQualityClip()
        The quality clip points that specify the subset of the basecalls that are good quality. If no clip is set, then the Range should be equal to Range.create(0,0);
        Returns:
        a Range (never null).

      • getAdapterClip

        Range getAdapterClip()
        The adapter clip points that specify the subset of the basecalls that are not adapter sequence. If no clip is set, then the Range should be equal to Range.create(0,0);
        Returns:
        a Range (never null).

      • getNumberOfFlows

        int getNumberOfFlows()
        Get the number of flows that this flowgram has.
        Returns:
        an int >=0.

      • getCalledFlowValue

        float getCalledFlowValue(int index)
        Get the flow value for the given flow index. The flow value is a float which is the estimated size of a homopolymer run for the given flow index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index into the flowgram values to get. Must be >=0 and < the number of flows.
        Returns:
        the flow value as a float.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is outside the number of flows specified by getNumberOfFlows().

      • getRawIndexes

        byte[] getRawIndexes()
        Get the raw flow indexes in the array returned by getRawEncodedFlowValues()
        Returns:
        a new byte array; never null

      • getRawEncodedFlowValues

        short[] getRawEncodedFlowValues()
        Get the raw flowgram values which contains the homopolymer stretch estimates for each flow of the read. This is equivalent to the SffReadData.getFlowgramValues().
        Returns:
        a new short array; never null

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Compares this SffFlowgram with the specified Object for equality. This method considers two SffFlowgram objects equal only if they are have equal id, basecalls, flowvalues, qualities and clip points.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code for this SffFlowgram. Hash code based on hashcodes for id, basecalls, flowvalues, qualities and clip points.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
